# Reference

<!-- DO NOT EDIT: This document was generated by Puppet Strings -->

## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`powerdns`](#powerdns): Manages powerdns authoritative server and recursor
* [`powerdns::authoritative`](#powerdns--authoritative): powerdns::authoritative
* [`powerdns::backends::bind`](#powerdns--backends--bind): bind backend for powerdns
* [`powerdns::backends::ldap`](#powerdns--backends--ldap): ldap backend for powerdns
* [`powerdns::backends::lmdb`](#powerdns--backends--lmdb): lmdb backend for powerdns
* [`powerdns::backends::mysql`](#powerdns--backends--mysql): mysql backend for powerdns
* [`powerdns::backends::postgresql`](#powerdns--backends--postgresql): postgresql backend for powerdns
* [`powerdns::backends::sqlite`](#powerdns--backends--sqlite): sqlite backend for powerdns
* [`powerdns::recursor`](#powerdns--recursor): powerdns recursor
* [`powerdns::repo`](#powerdns--repo): powerdns::repo

### Defined types

* [`powerdns::config`](#powerdns--config): Manage powerdns settings

### Resource types

* [`powerdns_autoprimary`](#powerdns_autoprimary): ensures autoprimary servers (for automatic provisioning of secondaries)
* [`powerdns_record`](#powerdns_record): ensure a zone exists.
* [`powerdns_zone`](#powerdns_zone): ensure a zone exists. The zone is managed using the resource powerdns_zone_private
* [`powerdns_zone_private`](#powerdns_zone_private): ensure a zone exists. This is a private class do NOT use it in your mannifests instead use powerdns_zone which will call this resource with t

### Data types

* [`Powerdns::Autoprimaries`](#Powerdns--Autoprimaries): Type Alias for Powerdns::Autoprimaries
* [`Powerdns::Backends`](#Powerdns--Backends): Type Alias for Powerdns::Backends
* [`Powerdns::ConfigValue`](#Powerdns--ConfigValue): Type Alias for Powerdns::ConfigValue
* [`Powerdns::LdapMethod`](#Powerdns--LdapMethod): Type Alias for Powerdns::LdapMethod
* [`Powerdns::LmdbSyncMode`](#Powerdns--LmdbSyncMode): Type Alias for Powerdns::LmdbSyncMode
* [`Powerdns::Secret`](#Powerdns--Secret): Type Alias for Powerdns::Secret

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative_package_name"></a>`authoritative_package_name`

Data type: `String[1]`

Name of the authoritative server package

Data type: `String[1]`

Authoritative server ensure property

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Extra packages to install with the authoritative server

Data type: `String[1]`

Authoritative server extra packages ensure property

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Authoritative config file path

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative_version"></a>`authoritative_version`

Data type: `Pattern[/[4,5]\.[0-9]+/]`

Authoritative server version

The direct parent directory will be managed by this module

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative"></a>`authoritative`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not this module will manage the authoritative server

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-powerdns--recursor"></a>`recursor`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not this module will manage the recursor

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-powerdns--backend"></a>`backend`

Data type: `Powerdns::Backends`

Which backend should the authoritative server use

Default value: `'mysql'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--backend_install"></a>`backend_install`

Data type: `Boolean`

If you set this to true it will try to install a database backend
for you. This requires `db_root_password`

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-powerdns--backend_create_tables"></a>`backend_create_tables`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not backend tables should be created

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-powerdns--db_root_password"></a>`db_root_password`

Data type: `Powerdns::Secret`

If you set `backend_install` to true you are asked top specify a root
password for your database

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--db_username"></a>`db_username`

Data type: `String[1]`

Backend database username

Default value: `'powerdns'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--db_password"></a>`db_password`

Data type: `Powerdns::Secret`

Backend database password

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--db_name"></a>`db_name`

Data type: `String[1]`

Backend database name

Default value: `'powerdns'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--db_host"></a>`db_host`

Data type: `Stdlib::Host`

Backend database host

Default value: `'localhost'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--db_port"></a>`db_port`

Data type: `Stdlib::Port`

Database port to use

Default value: `3306`

##### <a name="-powerdns--require_db_password"></a>`require_db_password`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not db_password must be set

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-powerdns--ldap_host"></a>`ldap_host`

Data type: `String[1]`

LDAP server to connect to

Default value: `'ldap://localhost/'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--ldap_basedn"></a>`ldap_basedn`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

LDAP base DN

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--ldap_method"></a>`ldap_method`

Data type: `Powerdns::LdapMethod`

LDAP method to use

Default value: `'strict'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--ldap_binddn"></a>`ldap_binddn`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

LDAP object to authenticate against

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--ldap_secret"></a>`ldap_secret`

Data type: `Powerdns::Secret`

LDAP password of the binddn object

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--lmdb_filename"></a>`lmdb_filename`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Filename for the lmdb database

Default value: `'/var/lib/powerdns/pdns.lmdb'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--lmdb_schema_version"></a>`lmdb_schema_version`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Maximum allowed schema version to run on this DB. If a lower version is found, auto update is performed

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--lmdb_shards"></a>`lmdb_shards`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Records database will be split into this number of shards

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--lmdb_sync_mode"></a>`lmdb_sync_mode`

Data type: `Powerdns::LmdbSyncMode`

Sync mode for LMDB. One of 'nosync', 'sync', 'nometasync', 'mapasync'

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-powerdns--custom_repo"></a>`custom_repo`

Data type: `Boolean`

Don't manage the PowerDNS repo with this module

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-powerdns--custom_epel"></a>`custom_epel`

Data type: `Boolean`

Don't manage the EPEL repo with this module

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-powerdns--forward_zones"></a>`forward_zones`

Data type: `Hash`

Configures recursor forward_zones

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-powerdns--autoprimaries"></a>`autoprimaries`

Data type: `Powerdns::Autoprimaries`

Hash of autoprimaries the ensurce (with resource powerdns_autoprimary)

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-powerdns--purge_autoprimaries"></a>`purge_autoprimaries`

Data type: `Boolean`

Set this to true if you like to purge all autoprimaries not managed with puppet

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative_user"></a>`authoritative_user`

Data type: `String[1]`

Under which user the authoritative server is running

Default value: `'pdns'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative_group"></a>`authoritative_group`

Data type: `String[1]`

Under which group the authoritative server is running

Default value: `'pdns'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative_file_owner"></a>`authoritative_file_owner`

Data type: `String[1]`

Owner of authoritative config files

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--authoritative_file_group"></a>`authoritative_file_group`

Data type: `String[1]`

Group of authoritative config files

Default value: `$authoritative_group`

The following parameters are available in the `powerdns::recursor` class:

* [`forward_zones`](#-powerdns--recursor--forward_zones)

##### <a name="-powerdns--recursor--forward_zones"></a>`forward_zones`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash containing zone => dns servers pairs

Default value: `$powerdns::forward_zones`

powerdns::repo

## Defined types

### <a name="powerdns--config"></a>`powerdns::config`

Manage powerdns settings

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `powerdns::config` defined type:

* [`setting`](#-powerdns--config--setting)
* [`value`](#-powerdns--config--value)
* [`ensure`](#-powerdns--config--ensure)
* [`type`](#-powerdns--config--type)

##### <a name="-powerdns--config--setting"></a>`setting`

Data type: `String[1]`

The setting you want to change

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="-powerdns--config--value"></a>`value`

Data type: `Powerdns::ConfigValue`

The value for the above setting

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-powerdns--config--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`

Specify whether or not this configuration should be present

Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="-powerdns--config--type"></a>`type`

Data type: `Enum['authoritative', 'recursor']`

If this configuration applies to the authoritative server
or the recursor

Default value: `'authoritative'`

## Resource types

### <a name="powerdns_autoprimary"></a>`powerdns_autoprimary`

ensures autoprimary servers (for automatic provisioning of secondaries)

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `powerdns_autoprimary` type.

##### `account`

account to ensure (default to no account)

Default value: `''`

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

Manage the state of this type.

Default value: `present`

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `powerdns_autoprimary` type.

* [`name`](#-powerdns_autoprimary--name)
* [`provider`](#-powerdns_autoprimary--provider)

##### <a name="-powerdns_autoprimary--name"></a>`name`

Valid values: `%r{^\S+@\S+$}`

namevar

name of the autoprimary in the format IP@NAMESERVER

##### <a name="-powerdns_autoprimary--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `powerdns_autoprimary` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet
will usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

### <a name="powerdns_record"></a>`powerdns_record`

ensure a zone exists.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `powerdns_record` type.

* [`name`](#-powerdns_record--name)
* [`rclass`](#-powerdns_record--rclass)
* [`rcontent`](#-powerdns_record--rcontent)
* [`rname`](#-powerdns_record--rname)
* [`rttl`](#-powerdns_record--rttl)
* [`rtype`](#-powerdns_record--rtype)
* [`target_zone`](#-powerdns_record--target_zone)

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--name"></a>`name`

namevar

name of the record as namevar

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--rclass"></a>`rclass`

the class of record (defaults to 'IN')

Default value: `IN`

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--rcontent"></a>`rcontent`

the content of the record

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--rname"></a>`rname`

the name of the record to add (remark target zone will be added)
defaults to the first characters of the title until the first '.'.
to add a record equal the taget_zone, add a '.' only.

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--rttl"></a>`rttl`

the ttl of the record

Default value: `3600`

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--rtype"></a>`rtype`

the record type

Default value: `A`

##### <a name="-powerdns_record--target_zone"></a>`target_zone`

the target zone defaults to all characters after the first . in the title.

### <a name="powerdns_zone"></a>`powerdns_zone`

ensure a zone exists. The zone is managed using the
resource powerdns_zone_private

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `powerdns_zone` type.

* [`config_dir`](#-powerdns_zone--config_dir)
* [`config_name`](#-powerdns_zone--config_name)
* [`manage_records`](#-powerdns_zone--manage_records)
* [`name`](#-powerdns_zone--name)
* [`show_diff`](#-powerdns_zone--show_diff)
* [`soa_class`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_class)
* [`soa_expire`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_expire)
* [`soa_minttl`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_minttl)
* [`soa_mname`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_mname)
* [`soa_refresh`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_refresh)
* [`soa_retry`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_retry)
* [`soa_rname`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_rname)
* [`soa_ttl`](#-powerdns_zone--soa_ttl)
* [`zone_ensure`](#-powerdns_zone--zone_ensure)

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--config_dir"></a>`config_dir`

Location directory of pdns.conf file for pdnsutil --config-dir parameter, defaults to '' which will ignore and take the
system default.

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--config_name"></a>`config_name`

Virtual configuration name for pdnsutil --config-name parameter, defaults to '' which will ignore the parameter.

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--manage_records"></a>`manage_records`

Valid values: `true`, `false`, `yes`, `no`

If puppet shall manage all zone records for the domain (any records not managed with puppet will be purged).
The default is true, to manage the SOA record and all zone records through puppet for the zone.
If set to false, ensurance of zone creation is done only and the administration of zone records needs to be done through
web Interface or any other preferred method.

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--name"></a>`name`

namevar

name of the zone name as namevar

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--show_diff"></a>`show_diff`

Valid values: `true`, `false`, `yes`, `no`

Whether to display differences when the zone changes, defaulting to
false. Since zones can be huge, use this only for debugging

Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_class"></a>`soa_class`

zone class for SOA record

Default value: `IN`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_expire"></a>`soa_expire`

Number of seconds after which secondary name servers should stop answering request for this zone if the master does not
respond.

Default value: `604800`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_minttl"></a>`soa_minttl`

Minimum ttl in seconds, negativ response caching ttl

Default value: `3600`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_mname"></a>`soa_mname`

primary master name server for the zone for SOA record

Default value: `a.powerdns.server`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_refresh"></a>`soa_refresh`

Number of seconds after which secondary name servers should query the master for the SOA record, to detect zone changes

Default value: `10800`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_retry"></a>`soa_retry`

Number of seconds after which secondary name servers should retry to request the serial number from the master if the
master does not respond

Default value: `3600`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_rname"></a>`soa_rname`

Email address of the administrator responsible for this zone for SOA record

Default value: `hostmaster`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--soa_ttl"></a>`soa_ttl`

ttl for SOA record

Default value: `3600`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone--zone_ensure"></a>`zone_ensure`

ensure parameter for the zone, use present/absent

Default value: `present`

### <a name="powerdns_zone_private"></a>`powerdns_zone_private`

ensure a zone exists. This is a private class do NOT use it in your mannifests instead use powerdns_zone which will
call this resource with the zone records added.

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `powerdns_zone_private` type.

##### `content`

Content (records) of the zone. This must match the output of 'pdnsutil list-zone ZONE|sort'.

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

Whether the zone should be present or absent

Default value: `present`

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `powerdns_zone_private` type.

* [`config_dir`](#-powerdns_zone_private--config_dir)
* [`config_name`](#-powerdns_zone_private--config_name)
* [`manage_records`](#-powerdns_zone_private--manage_records)
* [`name`](#-powerdns_zone_private--name)
* [`provider`](#-powerdns_zone_private--provider)
* [`show_diff`](#-powerdns_zone_private--show_diff)

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone_private--config_dir"></a>`config_dir`

Location of pdns.conf. Default is which will ignore the property.

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone_private--config_name"></a>`config_name`

Virtual configuration name, defaults to '' which will ignore the property.

Default value: `''`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone_private--manage_records"></a>`manage_records`

Valid values: `true`, `false`, `yes`, `no`

if we manage the all zone records for the domain (any records not managed with puppet will be purged).

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone_private--name"></a>`name`

namevar

name of the zone name as namevar

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone_private--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `powerdns_zone_private` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet
will usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

##### <a name="-powerdns_zone_private--show_diff"></a>`show_diff`

Valid values: `true`, `false`, `yes`, `no`

Whether to display differences when the zone changes, defaulting to
false. Since zones can be huge, use this only for debugging

Default value: `false`

## Data types

### <a name="Powerdns--Autoprimaries"></a>`Powerdns::Autoprimaries`

Type Alias for Powerdns::Autoprimaries

Alias of

```puppet
Hash[Pattern[/.+@.+/], Struct[{
      account => Optional[String],
  }]]
```

### <a name="Powerdns--Backends"></a>`Powerdns::Backends`

Type Alias for Powerdns::Backends

Alias of `Enum['ldap', 'mysql', 'bind', 'postgresql', 'sqlite', 'lmdb']`

### <a name="Powerdns--ConfigValue"></a>`Powerdns::ConfigValue`

Type Alias for Powerdns::ConfigValue

Alias of `Variant[String, Integer, Boolean, Sensitive[String[1]]]`

### <a name="Powerdns--LdapMethod"></a>`Powerdns::LdapMethod`

Type Alias for Powerdns::LdapMethod

Alias of `Enum['simple', 'tree', 'strict']`

### <a name="Powerdns--LmdbSyncMode"></a>`Powerdns::LmdbSyncMode`

Type Alias for Powerdns::LmdbSyncMode

Alias of

```puppet
Optional[Enum[
    'nosync',
    'sync',
    'nometasync',
    'mapasync',
  ]]
```

### <a name="Powerdns--Secret"></a>`Powerdns::Secret`

Type Alias for Powerdns::Secret

Alias of

```puppet
Optional[Variant[
    String[1],
    Sensitive[String[1]]
  ]]
```
